content.description: The second route I set on this wall. Make sure you place your TR anchor where I put it in the photo as it offers great protection and a good angle. Use the immediate tree and the tree far behind the route at an angle to the anchor point. The route has some interesting moves including an under cling, crimp, and stemming.  I cleaned the route thoroughly so enjoy.
content.protection: TR Anchor 50 feet static line plus two locking biners.
content.location: Right of baby dragon about 10 feet, left side of the arete.

content.description: It's a good first route. I rappelled down it to clean the route as best I could. It's a easy route and good for beginners. It's named after my son and daughter who were playing "baby dragons" nearby.
content.protection: You can top rope anchor to the V based tree. It's a large tree and good for a monolithic anchor.
content.location: There is a tree very close to the cliff that has a V base. That will be the top of the route. The route is at the first section of wall as you are coming up the path.

content.description: It's a relatively open area up the hill from glass run. The rock face is about 100 yards wide and at most 25 feet tall.
